```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(visdat)
```

```{r}
vis_dat(airquality)
```
```{r}
airquality_cleaned <- airquality %>% 
  distinct()
vis_dat(airquality_cleaned)
```

```{r}
# Remove
airquality_cleaned <- airquality %>% 
  drop_na()

vis_dat(airquality_cleaned)
```
```{r}
# To create the linear regression model, I used Ozone and Solar Radiation to measure their relationship and effect on the temperature. I think this is a valid model because it is statistically significant
lm_model <- lm(Temp ~ Ozone * Solar.R , data = airquality_cleaned)
summary(lm_model)
```
